author: Shelby Perea
title: Take a look inside the luxury home built by the founder of Albuquerque Tortilla Co. (slideshow)
text: The six large columns hold up… more courtesy Jessica Taylor 18 photos The pool and grill area of the walled backyard. It's a home with a lot of flavor, which you would expect coming from its builder, the Martinez family and founder of the Albuquerque Tortilla Co. The "Albuquerque Tortilla Mansion" is a 5,750 square foot two-story home in the North Valley off of Rio Grande Boulevard. It sits on a 1.12 acre lot and is listed for $925,000. Inside the first floor of the luxurious stucco home, there is a grand room, formal dining area, family room, two bedrooms, a study with wood desk detailing and shelving, three bathrooms and the kitchen — all floored with either marble, hardwood or carpet. Head up the grand staircase and you'll find a master suite with a workout room and two balconies. The walled backyard includes an outdoor kitchen, heated pool, hot tub and a cabana. 18 photos The pool and grill area of the walled backyard. Built in 1995, the home also features a wet bar, two gas log fireplaces and a three-car garage. In December 2016, the median sale price for homes was $190,000 and the average home sale price for 2016 was $225,115. The Albuquerque metro area saw 875 home sales in December and the number of new listings rose 5.6 percent for single-family detached homes while condos, townhomes and other attached homes dropped 10 percent. Christine Remington of Realty One is the listing agent. See the full listing here. The six large columns hold up… more courtesy Jessica Taylor
